displayAll.!description: Specify whether to display all the category values when there are multiple category data regions.

rangeSelectorStartPosition.!description: Specify the range selector start position, default value is 0.

thickness.!description: The line thickness of the primary line

busyIndicatorSize.!description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

showCategoryText.!description: Whether to display category's text on the Value Bubble

showValueOnPieChart.!description: Whether to display value on Pie or Donut chart

showLabel.!description: Indicates whether to show label of the Axis by the primary line

showLegendLabel.!description: Whether to display legend's label (Pie or Donut chart only)

busyIndicatorDelay.!description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

showTotalValue.!description: Specify whether to show the sum of the value for Waterfall/Waterfall Bar chart. Only applies to Waterfall/WaterfallBar chart.

secondaryColorPalette.!description: Allow a combination chart’s secondary axis color palette to be modified without affecting other charts' color palette. If not set, the chart will use the default color palette defined in the theme. Accept an array of color in string format or hex format. e.g. 0xff0000 "red" "rgb(255,0,0)"

sap.makit.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 MAKIT charts have been replaced with sap.viz and vizFrame in 1.38. This library will not be supported anymore from 1.38.
Mobile Chart controls based on the Sybase MAKIT charting lib.

visible.!description: Whether the Value Bubble is visible

lineThickness.!description: Specify the line thickness of the line graph. Only applies to Line chart type.

format.!description: Number formatting for the value. Accepted values: number currency percent roundedN - where N represents number of decimal places e.g. rounded4

showGrid.!description: Indicates whether to show grid of the Axis in the chart area

showCategoryDisplayName.!description: Whether to display category's display name on the Value Bubble

sap.makit.!helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 MAKIT charts have been replaced with sap.viz and vizFrame in 1.38. This library will not be supported anymore from 1.38.
Mobile Chart controls based on the Sybase MAKIT charting lib.

style.!description: Value Bubble positioning style (All the chart types except: Pie/Donut/HBar chart)

position.!description: The position of the Value Bubble (Pie or Donut chart only)

maxSliceCount.!description: Set the maximum number of slices in a Pie/Donut chart. If exceeding the specified value, the rest will be categorised into a single slice. Only applies to Pie/Donut.

showValueDisplayName.!description: Whether to display value's display name on the Value Bubble

showNullValue.!description: Whether to render null item on the Value Bubble

color.!description: Color of the primary line. Accept the following format: standard name format: gray, red, black, etc hex format: #ff00ff rgb format: rgb(256, 0, 256)

drawOnSecondaryAxis.!description: Specifiy whether this layer should be drawn on the secondary axis.

displayName.!description: The text label representing this Value (on value bubble or table's header)

displayLastLabel.!description: Whether to always display the last label on the axis regardless of the automatic resize

locale.!description: Comma separated locales for specifiying values in different locale. The locale will be mapped in the same order as the series data. e.g. zh-CH, en-US, de-DE The first zh-CH will be applied to the value of the first series, en-US will be applied to the second series. Currently will only work with 'currency' format. Supported locales: en, zh, de, fr, es, ru, ja, pt and their more specific variations such as en-CA, es-AR, zh-HK, etc.

numberOfVisibleCategories.!description: The number of categories that will be visible on the chart at any time. The minimum value is 2. If not set, the number of visible categories will be automatically adjusted depending on the screen size

min.!description: Highest displayed value on the Value Axis (this value will be automatically adjusted to nearest major tick value depending on the value's range). Set to empty string to switch back to automatic calculation.

blocked.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.69 The blocked property is deprecated. There is no accessibility support for this property. Blocked controls should not be used inside Controls, which rely on keyboard navigation, e.g. List controls.
Whether the control is currently in blocked state.

busy.!description: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

fieldGroupIds.!description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

value.!description: The value mapped to this Column (User should map this using data binding)

expression.!description: The user should map the column on this property. The expression allows more advanced column mapping. Instead of just specifying the column name (e.g. revenueValue), the user can use SAP expression language e.g. Assuming the user has a revenueValue column and an operatingCost column, the user can specify the following expression: "revenueValue - operatingCost" the resulting value displayed in the chart will be the arithmatic operation result on these two columns.

max.!description: Highest displayed value on the Value Axis (this value will be automatically adjusted to nearest major tick value depending on the value's range)

showPrimaryLine.!description: Indicates whether to show the primary line of the Axis on the chart area

column.!description: The name of the column that will be mapped to the chart's Series value

showTableValue.!description: Toggle to display the table value on a Bar chart. Only applies to Bar chart.

primaryColorPalette.!description: Allow a layer’s primary axis color palette to be modified without affecting other charts in the same screen. If not set, the chart will use the default color palette defined in the theme. This property will take precedence over other CombinationChart's color palette properties. Accept an array of color in string format or hex format. e.g. 0xff0000 "red" "rgb(255,0,0)"

showRangeSelector.!description: Specify whether the range selector should be visible.

legendPosition.!description: Legend position for Pie /Donut chart only.

sap.makit.ValueBubbleStyle.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 MAKIT charts have been replaced with sap.viz and vizFrame in 1.38. This control will not be supported anymore from 1.38.
Enumeration for Value Bubble's positioning style. This applies all chart types except Pie/Donut/HBar chart.

Float.!description: The Value Bubble floats on the touch point, chart's size will not change.

FloatTop.!description: The Value Bubble floats and snaps above of the chart, chart's size will not change.

Top.!description: The Value Bubble snaps above of the chart, the chart height will adjust accordingly.

sap.makit.CombinationChart.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new CombinationChart. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getShowRangeSelector showRangeSelector} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getLegendPosition legendPosition} : sap.makit.LegendPosition (default: Left)
    • {@link #getPrimaryColorPalette primaryColorPalette} : any
    • {@link #getSecondaryColorPalette secondaryColorPalette} : any
    • {@link #getShowTableValue showTableValue} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getNumberOfVisibleCategories numberOfVisibleCategories} : int
    • {@link #getRangeSelectorStartPosition rangeSelectorStartPosition} : int (default: 0)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getCategoryRegions categoryRegions} : sap.makit.Category[]
    • {@link #getLayers layers} : sap.makit.Layer[]
    • {@link #getCategoryAxis categoryAxis} : sap.makit.CategoryAxis
    • {@link #getPrimaryValueAxis primaryValueAxis} : sap.makit.ValueAxis
    • {@link #getSecondaryValueAxis secondaryValueAxis} : sap.makit.ValueAxis
    • {@link #getValueBubble valueBubble} : sap.makit.ValueBubble
  • Events
    • {@link #event:doubletap doubletap} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:tap tap} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:longpress longpress} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

getExpression.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getExpression expression}.

The user should map the column on this property. The expression allows more advanced column mapping. Instead of just specifying the column name (e.g. revenueValue), the user can use SAP expression language e.g. Assuming the user has a revenueValue column and an operatingCost column, the user can specify the following expression: "revenueValue - operatingCost" the resulting value displayed in the chart will be the arithmatic operation result on these two columns.

Instead of just specifying the column name (e.g. revenueValue), the user can use SAP expression language e.g. Assuming the user has a revenueValue column and an operatingCost column, the user can specify the following expression: "revenueValue - operatingCost" the resulting value displayed in the chart will be the arithmatic operation result on these two columns. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sExpression: type: string, description: New value for property expression

getLocale.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getLocale locale}.

Comma separated locales for specifiying values in different locale. The locale will be mapped in the same order as the series data. e.g. zh-CH, en-US, de-DE The first zh-CH will be applied to the value of the first series, en-US will be applied to the second series. Currently will only work with 'currency' format. Supported locales: en, zh, de, fr, es, ru, ja, pt and their more specific variations such as en-CA, es-AR, zh-HK, etc.

Currently will only work with 'currency' format. Supported locales: en, zh, de, fr, es, ru, ja, pt and their more specific variations such as en-CA, es-AR, zh-HK, etc. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

sap.makit.Chart.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Chart. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getType type} : sap.makit.ChartType (default: Column)
    • {@link #getShowRangeSelector showRangeSelector} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowTableView showTableView} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getLegendPosition legendPosition} : sap.makit.LegendPosition
    • {@link #getLineThickness lineThickness} : float (default: 1)
    • {@link #getShowTableValue showTableValue} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getMaxSliceCount maxSliceCount} : int (default: 12)
    • {@link #getPrimaryColorPalette primaryColorPalette} : any
    • {@link #getShowTotalValue showTotalValue} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getNumberOfVisibleCategories numberOfVisibleCategories} : int
    • {@link #getRangeSelectorStartPosition rangeSelectorStartPosition} : int (default: 0)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getRows rows} : sap.makit.Row[]
    • {@link #getColumns columns} : sap.makit.Column[]
    • {@link #getSeries series} : sap.makit.Series
    • {@link #getValues values} : sap.makit.Value[]
    • {@link #getCategoryRegions categoryRegions} : sap.makit.Category[]
    • {@link #getCategory category} : sap.makit.Category
    • {@link #getCategoryAxis categoryAxis} : sap.makit.CategoryAxis
    • {@link #getValueAxis valueAxis} : sap.makit.ValueAxis
    • {@link #getValueBubble valueBubble} : sap.makit.ValueBubble
  • Events
    • {@link #event:doubletap doubletap} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:tap tap} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:longpress longpress} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

parameters.fLineThickness: type: float, description: New value for property lineThickness

setLegendPosition.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getLegendPosition legendPosition}. Legend position all chart types except Bar chart. Default position for Pie/Donut chart is Left. All other chart's default position is None. Note: the default legend position is set when the chart type is set first time, subsequent change to the chart type will keep using initial legend position unless it is changed explicitly by user. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Gets current value of property {@link #getPrimaryColorPalette primaryColorPalette}.

Allow a chart’s color palette to be modified without affecting the other charts' color palette. If not set, the chart will use the default color palette defined in the theme. Accept an array of color in string format or hex format. e.g. 0xff0000 "red" "rgb(255,0,0)"

sap.makit.Column.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Column. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getName name} : string
    • {@link #getValue value} : any
    • {@link #getType type} : string (default: string)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.
